LEAD AND MENTOR YOUNG PEOPLE
SEASONAL ROLES WITH THE CHALLENGE
The Challenge is the UK's largest provider of National Citizen Service (NCS) - an exciting youth and community programme devoted to strengthening communities and building young people's confidence and skills.
We have paid positions available for talented, enthusiastic and experienced individuals from all entry levels - if you're interested in youth work, facilitation or social care a role with The Challenge is for you!
OUR SEASONAL ROLES
We have a number of diverse and challenging roles available on our seasonal programmes, from leadership and mentoring to skill-sharing and logistical roles. Many of our positions have a residential element, and start dates can be worked around your schedule.
Work as a Leader and guide 60-84 young people through the programe, or take on one of our Mentor roles, facilitating sessions and pastorally caring for a small team. Provide one-to-one support and assistance in the Support Worker role, or showcase and share your music, film, photography, sport, drama or enterprise skills as a Practitioner. Wherever your skills lie, we have a great role for you!
Further information on our seasonal roles, including full role descriptions, can be found at ncsthechallenge.org/seasonal-roles.
OUR SEASONAL PROGRAMMES
We run NCS programmes throughout the year - all of our seasonal programmes take place during school breaks, so our roles are perfect for teachers, support assistants and other school-based professionals.
The NCS seasonal programmes currently take place during February half-term, with some March weekends; during the summer holidays, from late June until early October; and during October half-term with some weekends in November.
For further information on the NCS programmes, head to www.ncsthechallenge.org now
